item.title: Projects
item.description: I learn through doing, so these projects stand to show my abilities more than official certifications. Each one I’ve done is a functional, holistic application (albeit, not with a high level of polish). Dotfile Docker Stack Server Stack is a project done with the end goal of making a fully independant web presence, i.e. done entirely without reliance on AWS or other cloud services. The only service which isn’t directly provided is domain names, which have to come from ICANN.

item.title: Hello, Hugo!
item.description: Good god this website changes a lot. Starting as a hacked-together hand written set of HTML documents in 2017, it seems to’ve annualy gone through a major facelift. First to Vuepress site (for which archives for don’t really work). Now I’m happy to be able to announce v3.0, entirely in hugo, now with a cool blog-thing which I hope I can use now.

item.title: Résumé
item.description: If you would like a copy of my resume, it is available below in odt and pdf formats. Please note that they have been modified to remove contact information I don’t want floating around on the internet. if you have a business inquiry please email me (address is availble on my homepage). item.title: About Me
item.description: Hello, World! I’m Whit Huntley a student, programmer, and activist. OpenPGP Key 2CE2 F0FA 3F3E 8078 1544 7A06 B5B5 EEA4 64CA 97AB Programming I started programming in 2012 at a Java+Scratch summer class for my parents to get me out of the house for a change. While what I wrote there was absolutely abhorrent, I loved the theory and wanted to pursue it further. In 2013, I began attending SkilStak Coding Arts where I learned the essentials of Python 3, Golang, and nebulous Linux things (bash, vim, ssh, git, and so on).

item.title: Acknowledgements
item.description: Here are acknowledgments and licensing info about this site. This site is built with hugo, and the template a modified version of the theme rhazdon/hugo-theme-hello-friend-ng. The content on this site, unless otherwise stated, is licensed under the CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 license and GNU/AGPL3 license. More information about my licenses are available here and this website’s source code is available at Git@Dotfile.

item.title: Schoolwork Portal
item.description: This is the hub for all of my works done for my school classes. All work is licensed under the Creative Commons BY-NC-SA 4.0 Intl license or the The GNU Affero General Public License v3.0. (learn more about licensing) Go to Current Classes This contains a link to all of my current work for the current semester. If a file is missing or you need access to an older archive, please get in touch via email!
